reasoning: Ectrodactyly is a rare congenital malformation with prevalence estimated at 1-3 per 100,000 live births globally. Using prevalence metric as this is a lifelong genetic condition with clear phenotype. Confidence moderate due to limited epidemiological data and potential geographic variation in ascertainment.
source: Oberg KC et al. (2010). Developmental Biology and Genetics of Hand and Foot Malformations. Birth Defects Res Part C. 90(4):313-332
